data.event: Alta was founded about 1865 to house miners from the Emma mine, the Flagstaff mine, and other silver mines in Little Cottonwood Canyon.
An 1878 fire and an 1885 avalanche destroyed most of the original mining town, though some mining activity persisted into the 20th century.

event.title: the 1930s, only one resident, George Watson, remained

data.event: By the 1930s, only one resident, George Watson, remained in the town.

event.title: 1935, Norwegian skiing legend Alf Engen was hired

data.event: In 1935, Norwegian skiing legend Alf Engen was hired to help develop the area, and Alta opened its first ski lift in 1938.

event.title: opened its first ski lift in 1938

data.event: In 1935, Norwegian skiing legend Alf Engen was hired to help develop the area, and Alta opened its first ski lift in 1938.
